title.native: 境界線上のホライゾン
title.english: Horizon in the Middle of Nowhere

description:
In the far future, humans abandon a devastated Earth and traveled to outer space. However, due to unknown phenomenon that prevents them from traveling into space, humanity returns to Earth only to find it inhospitable except for Japan.

To accomodate the entire human population, pocket dimensions are created around Japan to house in the populace. In order to find a way to return to outer space, the humans began reenacting human history according to the Holy book Testament. But in the year 1413 of the Testament Era, the nations of the pocket dimensions invade and conquer Japan, dividing the territory into feudal fiefdoms and forcing the original inhabitants of Japan to leave.

It is now the year 1648 of the Testament Era, the refugees of Japan now live in the city ship Musashi, where it constantly travels around Japan while being watched by the Testament Union, the authority that runs the re-enactment of history. However, rumors of an apocalypse and war begins to spread when the Testament stops revealing what happens next after 1648.

Taking advantage of this situation, Toori Aoi, head of Musashi Ariadust Academy's Supreme Federation and President of the student council, leads his fellow classmates to use this opportunity to regain their homeland.

(Source: Wikipedia)
synonyms: Horizon on the Middle of Nowhere

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

node.description:
__Height:__ 158cm
__Nickname:__ Minorin (みのりん)

[Official Website](https://www.minorichihara.com/) | [Profile (HoriPro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/chihara) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/chiharaminori/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/minori_parade/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minori_contact) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minori_chihara/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minori_Chihara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茅原実里)

Minori Chihara is a Japanese voice actress and singer.

On April 2, 2021, she announced via her blog that she was taking an indefinite hiatus on her singing activities at the end of the year, but continuing to voice act.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__
- Azami - Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (VG)
- Dorothy - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Jean](https://anilist.co/character/190865/Jean-Gunnhildr) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Kotori Kanbe](https://anilist.co/character/37486/) - Rewrite (VG)
- Mayer - Arknights (VG)
- [Wakamo Kosaka](https://anilist.co/character/287031/) - Blue Archive (VG)
- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
Ceui is a Japanese singer–songwriter originally from Chiba, Japan, though she grew up in Fukuoka. Ceui's name is derived from the Portuguese word for sky, céu.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/122813934)

Originating from Studio Fuga.

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.
Made his directorial debut with [Katekyou Hitman Reborn!](https://anilist.co/anime/1604/), in which he storyboarded half of the episodes.
